title: Domain 1.4: Given a scenario, configure basic mobile device network connectivity and application support.
content:
ğŸ“¶ WIRELESS / CELLULAR DATA NETWORK (Enable/Disable)

ğŸ“± 2G / 3G / 4G / 5G

These refer to generations of cellular networks:

  • 2G: Text + calls only (GSM/CDMA)
  • 3G: Basic mobile internet
  • 4G (LTE): Fast mobile data, streaming
  • 5G: Ultra-fast, low latency, used for IoT, smart cities

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: If the question says "user canâ€™t access high-speed data," check if the phone is stuck on 3G or 2G.

ğŸ“¡ Hotspot

Turns your phone into a Wi-Fi router, sharing your mobile data.

Must enable Mobile Hotspot in settings. Requires password to connect securely.

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: Common troubleshooting scenario: "User can connect to hotspot but has no internet" â†’ likely issue with cellular data or hotspot settings.

ğŸŒ GSM vs. CDMA

Two types of older network tech:

  • GSM (Global System for Mobile): Uses SIM cards, widely used globally
  • CDMA (Code Division Multiple Access): No SIM cards originally; tied to the device (Verizon/older Sprint)

Today, most phones use GSM or LTE-based tech.

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: If a phone doesnâ€™t work internationally, itâ€™s probably locked to CDMA or doesnâ€™t support GSM bands.

ğŸ”„ PRL (Preferred Roaming List) Updates

Tells your phone which towers to connect to when roaming. Important for CDMA phones.

You usually update it via a code or setting menu (e.g., dialing *228).

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: If a user travels and has poor signal even in supported areas, suggest a PRL update.

ğŸ”µ BLUETOOTH CONFIGURATION

âœ… Enable Bluetooth

Toggle in Settings > Bluetooth. Must be turned on before pairing.

ğŸ” Enable Pairing Mode

Some devices need to be in pairing mode to be detected (e.g., holding a button for 5 sec).

ğŸ” Find a Device for Pairing

Your device will scan nearby Bluetooth devices. Choose the correct name from the list.

ğŸ” Enter PIN Code

Some accessories (like headsets) require a PIN (e.g., 0000, 1234). Modern devices may auto-pair or show matching confirmation codes.

ğŸ§ª Test Connectivity

After pairing, test by:

  • Playing music on Bluetooth speaker
  • Making a call with a Bluetooth headset
  • Transferring files

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: Be ready to troubleshoot common pairing issues:
Device not showing â†’ not in pairing mode
Doesnâ€™t connect â†’ wrong PIN or already paired to another device

ğŸ“ LOCATION SERVICES

ğŸ›°ï¸ GPS (Global Positioning System)

Uses satellites to determine device location. Works even without data, but slower to update. Used in navigation, location-based apps, geotagging.

ğŸ“¶ Cellular Location Services

Uses cell towers, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth beacons to estimate position faster than GPS. Used by apps like ride-sharing, maps, weather.

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: GPS = outdoors, accurate but slower. Cellular/Wi-Fi = faster, less accurate, works indoors.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ MOBILE DEVICE MANAGEMENT (MDM) / MOBILE APPLICATION MANAGEMENT (MAM)

ğŸ§­ Corporate Email Configuration

MDMs push email profiles (like Outlook) with pre-set server, port, security info. Helps secure work accounts and simplify setup.

ğŸ” Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

Adds security: user must verify identity using a second method, like:

  • SMS code
  • App (e.g., Authy, Microsoft Authenticator)
  • Biometric (Face ID, fingerprint)

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: If the scenario mentions "company requires PIN + fingerprint," thatâ€™s 2FA under MDM.

ğŸ§© Corporate Applications

MDMs can remotely install, restrict, or wipe work apps. Prevents data leaks by managing access to company data.

ğŸ§  Remember: MDM = device-wide control. MAM = controls apps only (like containerized work email).

ğŸ” MOBILE DEVICE SYNCHRONIZATION

ğŸ“§ Account Setup

Connect mobile to cloud services (Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, iCloud). Settings > Accounts > Add account.

ğŸ“‚ Data to Synchronize

Syncing keeps info consistent across devices:

  • Mail â€“ Real-time access to email
  • Photos â€“ Backup to cloud (Google Photos, iCloud)
  • Calendar â€“ Sync events across devices
  • Contacts â€“ Shared address book

Recognizing Data Caps â€“ Some services allow Wi-Fi only sync to save cellular data.

ğŸ§  Exam Tip: "User ran out of data quickly after enabling photo sync" â†’ disable sync over cellular.

âœ… FINAL EXAM CHECKLIST FOR 1.4 (Middle + Right)

  • GPS = satellite, outdoor accuracy.
  • Cellular location = quick, works indoors.
  • MDM = enforces security and app policy.
  • MAM = controls work apps only.
  • 2FA = PIN + biometric or token.
  • Sync setup = Account + what data to sync.
  • Watch for data usage concerns during sync.
